articles.title: New Tiny-Armed Carnivorous Dinosaur Discovered In Argentina
articles.description: A new species of dinosaur, a distant relative of the Carnotaurus, has been discovered in the South American country.
articles.content:
A new member of the abelisauridae family of dinosaurs has been discovered. This group of dinos are large therapod carnivores characterized by their incredibly small forearms – so tiny that they are often considered armless.
The new species, Guemesia ... [2423 chars]

articles.title: GRAINS-Soybeans hit highest in more than a week; corn, wheat jump
articles.description: SINGAPORE, Feb 22 (Reuters) - Chicago soybean futures rose for a fourth consecutive session on Tuesday and hit their highest in more than a week on concerns over dry weather in Brazil and Argentina curbing yields.Corn rose to a seven-month top, while wheat jumped more than 2% to a four-week high.FUNDAMENTALS* The most-active soybean contract on the Chicago Board of Trade
articles.content:
SINGAPORE, Feb 22 (Reuters) - Chicago soybean futures rose for a fourth consecutive session on Tuesday and hit their highest in more than a week on concerns over dry weather in Brazil and Argentina curbing yields.
Corn rose to a seven-month top, whil... [2711 chars]

articles.title: Colombia legalises abortion in move celebrated as ‘historic victory’ by campaigners
articles.description: Colombia has decriminalised abortion during the first 24 weeks of pregnancy, following rulings in Mexico and Argentina that improve access to abortion
articles.content:
Colombia has decriminalised abortion during the first 24 weeks of pregnancy, adding to a recent string of legal victories for reproductive rights in Latin America.
The South American country’s constitutional court ruled five against four to decrimina... [3638 chars]

articles.title: Colombia's Highest Court Decriminalizes Abortion: Live Updates
articles.description: The decision by the Constitutional Court comes in the wake of similar moves in Mexico and Argentina.
articles.content:

articles.title: Argentine crops could keep losing yield until March due to drought - exchange
articles.description: BUENOS AIRES, Feb 21 (Reuters) - Argentina's 2021/22 soybean and corn crops could see yields continue to decline in the weeks ahead with abundant rains only expected to arrive in mid-March to relieve a lengthy period of dry weather, the Buenos Aires grains exchange said on Monday.Argentina is the world's top exporter of soybean oil and meal, and the second largest for corn,

articles.title: 'Catastrophe': firefighters, volunteers battle blazes in Argentina's north
articles.description: "The truth is that the province is experiencing a catastrophe with these fires," he said, taking a break from trying to douse blazes which have burned farming regions and wetland areas rich with wildlife. "There is a lot of loss of animals, the issue of flora and fauna.
articles.content:
Luis Candia is battling to put out raging wildfires in Argentina's northern Corrientes province, which have scarred the region burning over 800,000 hectares of land, more than twice the size of Rhode Island.
With a water pack on his back and his face... [1256 chars]

articles.title: Argentina grains inspectors start 24-hour strike; 'no impact' at ports
articles.description: By Maximilian HeathBUENOS AIRES, Feb 21 (Reuters) - Argentina's grains inspectors began a 24-hour strike on Monday demanding bonus payments, but port activity and shipments of farm products were not affected in the South American country, the top global exporter of processed soybeans.Juan Carlos Peralta, press secretary of the URGARA union, said there was strong compliance
